comment.author: 51035743246@N01
comment._content: Fred (Jumbo) Wells of New Zealand. He's mentioned in this December 10, 1911 article where he raced at Madison Square Garden. He's mentioned near the end. The article has several pictures of other racers.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the information and citation to the article!  We'll add to the title in the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 64942209@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called The Bicycle, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 24202979@N06
comment._content: Fred Wells was still racing in New Zealand in April 1909, when he won the 3 and 5 mile national championships. (Wanganui Herald, Volume XXXXIV, Issue 12742, 13 April 1909, Page 6). By 3 August, 1909, He'd won the Mile Professional Handicap Race at the Salt Palace track in Salt Lake City, UT. (Wellington Evening Post, Volume LXXVIII, Issue 73, 23 September 1909, Page 8). Despite being a champion cyclist, Fred may not have been the brightest of lads: paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/cgi-bin/paperspast?a=d&cl=s... He's described as coming from Havelock, which is at the top of NZ's South Island. He may have been racing into the 20s: paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/cgi-bin/paperspast?a=d&cl=s...
